description: From a dialectal variant of twirl, possibly representing a blend of twirl +‎ curl. Cognate with German querlen (“to twirl”).

verbs.description: querl (third-person singular simple present querls, present participle querling, simple past and past participle querled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To twirl; turn or wind around; coil.
examples: to querl a cord, thread, or rope
